GroboUtils has support for multithreaded unit tests, though I've yet to use
it.



-Mitch

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
stixwix00
Sent: Wednesday, November 09, 2005 12:59 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Get JUnit to fail in 'child' thread



Hi,

Does anyone know of an elegant way to get a JUnit test to fail when it
throws an assertTrue() exception in a separate thread?

So the code might be:

public class MyTest extends TestCase{

class Worker extends Thread {
public void run(){
assertTrue(false);
}
}

public void testMain() {
Worker w = new Worker();
w.start();
}

When you run the above test, JUnit thinks the test passed.
I know I could have a boolean at the outer class level, set it when I
get a failure in the thread, and then assertTrue() on this in
testMain() after joining thread w, but there must be a better way!

Thanks.
Andy
